SEARCH
Package examblock.model

Interface Registry

All Known Implementing Classes:
RegistryImpl
public interface Registry
Interface for a registry that manages shared instances of ManageableListItem objects, such as Exam, Session, or Student. Provides methods to add, find, remove, and list items by type, ensuring a single source of truth for shared data across the application. Supports dependency injection by allowing classes like Student to query items without owning them.

  • Method Details

    • contains

      <T extends ManageableListItem> boolean contains(String id, Class<T> type)
      Checks if an item with the given ID exists for the specified type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the item, extending ManageableListItem
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier to check
      type - the class of the item
      Returns:
      true if an item with the ID exists, false otherwise

    • add

      <T extends ManageableListItem> void add(T item, Class<T> type)
      Adds an item to the registry for the specified type. The item is stored with its unique ManageableListItem.getId() for fast lookup and added to an ordered list for iteration.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the item, extending ManageableListItem
      Parameters:
      item - the item to add
      type - the class of the item

    • find

      <T extends ManageableListItem> T find(String id, Class<T> type)
      Finds an item by its unique ID for the specified type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the item, extending ManageableListItem
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the item
      type - the class of the item
      Returns:
      the item if found, or null if not found

    • get

      <T extends ManageableListItem> T get(String id, Class<T> type)
      Finds an item by its unique ID for the specified type. Unlike find(), get will throw a RuntimeException if the item is not found
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the item, extending ManageableListItem
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the item
      type - the class of the item
      Returns:
      the item if found, or throw new RuntimeException if not found

    • remove

      <T extends ManageableListItem> void remove(String id, Class<T> type)
      Removes an item by its unique ID for the specified type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the item, extending ManageableListItem
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the item
      type - the class of the item

    • removeAll

      <T extends ManageableListItem> void removeAll(Class<T> type)
      Removes all items of the specified type from the registry, clearing both the ID-based map and the ordered ID list for that type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the items, extending ManageableListItem
      Parameters:
      type - the class of the items to remove

    • getAll

      <T extends ManageableListItem> List<T> getAll(Class<T> type)
      Returns a copy of the ordered list of all items for the specified type. The returned list is read-only in structure (adding/removing items does not affect the registry), but item fields can be modified, affecting all references.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the items, extending ManageableListItem
      Parameters:
      type - the class of the items
      Returns:
      a new list containing all items of the specified type

    • getAt

      <T extends ManageableListItem> T getAt(int row, Class<T> type)
      Retrieves an item at the specified index in the ordered list for the given type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the item, extending ManageableListItem
      Parameters:
      row - the index of the item (0-based)
      type - the class of the item
      Returns:
      the item at the index, or null if the index is invalid

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clears all items from the registry, removing all types and their associated data.

    • count

      <T extends ManageableListItem> int count(Class<T> type)
      Returns the number of items stored for the specified type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the items, extending ManageableListItem
      Parameters:
      type - the class of the items
      Returns:
      the number of items
